name: Mayor’s Award
description: A recognition program for students who complete 60+ volunteer hours over summer break; application typically opens in spring and closes in fall.

name: Commissioners’ Award
description: An award recognizing high volunteer commitment during summer break; students submit hours during the application window for consideration.

name: Governor's and Key Volunteer Service Awards
description: A volunteer recognition program where county selections may advance for statewide recognition; top volunteers may receive additional honors.

name: NC Science Olympiad
description: A statewide STEM competition where students compete in biology-related events such as anatomy, ecology, and genetics at regional and state tournaments.

name: NC Ready, Set, App!
description: A North Carolina app development competition where students design and submit original mobile apps to solve real-world problems.

name: NC Technology Student Association (TSA)
description: A competitive organization offering engineering, design, and technology events at regional and state conferences across North Carolina.

name: NC Envirothon
description: A hands-on environmental science competition focused on ecology, soil science, forestry, and current environmental issues.

name: NC Math Contest
description: A statewide mathematics competition sponsored by NC organizations that challenges students with advanced problem-solving questions.

name: Scholastic Writing Awards – NC Region
description: The North Carolina regional branch of the Scholastic Awards, recognizing student achievement in creative and critical writing.

name: DPAC Rising Star Award
description: A statewide awards program celebrating excellence in high school musical theatre performance and production.

name: NC DECA Competitive Events
description: State-level business, marketing, and entrepreneurship competitions through North Carolina DECA.

name: NC Writers' Network Thomas Wolfe Fiction Prize
description: The Thomas Wolfe Fiction Prize, sponsored by the North Carolina Writers’ Network, awards $1,000 and publication in The Thomas Wolfe Review to honor outstanding fiction inspired by North Carolina novelist Thomas Wolfe.
